snippet: The killings of at least 15 people by United States Border Patrol agents have spurred criticism of the agency, which some say lacks oversight and accountability.
abstract: Shootings by United States Border Patrol agents have caused deaths of at least 15 people and increased border tensions with Mexico; shootings, sometimes during confrontations that began with assaults on agents, other times under less clear circumstances, are bolstering criticism of agents and customs officers who operate along border; killings are a jolt to careful balance of sovereignty and security that underlies binational debate over immigration reform.
lead_paragraph: The killings of at least 15 people by United States Border Patrol agents have spurred criticism of the agency, which some say lacks oversight and accountability.

headline.main: Shootings by Agents Increase Border Tensions
headline.print_headline: Shootings by Agents Increase Border Tensions
